timeline.message: Rewrite config convergence checker to use async http client

Don't reuse clients

The unit tests never closes the config convergence checker, causing stale connections to eventually exhaust the limit for max open files.
Specify that connection manager is not shared

timeline.author: jonmv

replies.bodyText: I think they are equivalent (LogLevel being the Vespa wrapper for Level). Any benefits using Level instead?
replies.author: bjorncs

replies.bodyText: I know @gjoranv went to great lengths to replace with Level values some time ago. I don't know why, though.
replies.author: jonmv

replies.bodyText: Ok, I removed use of LogLevel in new PR.
replies.author: bjorncs

replies.bodyText: I had to remove LogLevel from config in order to use config inside vespalog, and then it was proposed to remove LogLevel usage from all modules. I think the motivation was that custom log levels are unnecessary and a bit odd.
replies.author: gjoranv
